natural problem: Find all solutions $x$ of the inequality $$\frac{5}{24} + \left|x-\frac{11}{48}\right| < \frac{5}{16}.$$Express your answer in interval notation, simplifying all fractions in your answer.
natural solution: We can make our work easier by rewriting all fractions in the inequality so that they have a common denominator of $48$: $$\frac{10}{48} + \left|x-\frac{11}{48}\right| < \frac{15}{48}$$Then we subtract $\frac{10}{48}$ from both sides: $$\left|x-\frac{11}{48}\right| < \frac{5}{48}$$The expression on the left side is the positive difference between $x$ and $\frac{11}{48}$.
So, the inequality says that $x$ is strictly between $\frac{11}{48}-\frac{5}{48}$ and $\frac{11}{48}+\frac{5}{48}$.
Simplifying these expressions and writing our answer in interval notation, we have $x\in\boxed{\left(\frac{1}{8},\frac{1}{3}\right)}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "5 / 24 + abs(x - 11 / 48) < 5 / 16"
shows  "x > 1 / 8 \<and> x < 1 / 3"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find all solutions $x$ of the inequality $$\frac{5}{24} + \left|x-\frac{11}{48}\right| < \frac{5}{16}.$$Express your answer in interval notation, simplifying all fractions in your answer. The final Answer is \left(\frac{1}{8},\frac{1}{3}\right)
 ### Proof
 We can make our work easier by rewriting all fractions in the inequality so that they have a common denominator of $48$: $$\frac{10}{48} + \left|x-\frac{11}{48}\right| < \frac{15}{48}$$Then we subtract $\frac{10}{48}$ from both sides: $$\left|x-\frac{11}{48}\right| < \frac{5}{48}$$The expression on the left side is the positive difference between $x$ and $\frac{11}{48}$.
 So, the inequality says that $x$ is strictly between $\frac{11}{48}-\frac{5}{48}$ and $\frac{11}{48}+\frac{5}{48}$.
 Simplifying these expressions and writing our answer in interval notation, we have $x\in\boxed{\left(\frac{1}{8},\frac{1}{3}\right)}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "5 / 24 + abs(x - 11 / 48) < 5 / 16"
shows  "x > 1 / 8 \<and> x < 1 / 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the range of values for $x$ such that the absolute difference between $x$ and $\frac{11}{48}$ is less than $\frac{5}{16} - \frac{5}{24}$. The solution is that $x$ is greater than $\frac{1}{8}$ and less than $\frac{1}{3}$.

shows  "x > 1 / 8" and "x < 1 / 3"

 Simplifying these expressions and writing our answer in interval notation, we have $x\in\boxed{\left(\frac{1}{8},\frac{1}{3}\right)}$.

fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "abs (x - 11 / 48) < 5 / 16 - 5 / 24"
shows  "x > 1 / 8" and "x < 1 / 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

fixes x :: real
shows  "(abs(x - 11/48) + 5/24) < 5/16 \<longleftrightarrow> (1/8 < x \<and> x < 1/3)"

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "5/24 + abs (x - 11/48) < 5/16 \<longleftrightarrow> x \<in> {1/8<..<1/3}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: The real number $x$ satisfies the inequality $5/24 + |x - 11/48| < 5/16$ if and only if $x$ is in the open interval $(1/8, 1/3)$.
